Una implementaci—n real de SSO, deber‡ contar con un agente SSO que se encarga de almacenar en una base de datos o directorio protegido los passwords que le permiten al usuario acceder a cada una de las aplicaciones o servicios, en el momento que lo desee, ya que el proceso de login se realiza de manera transparente al usuario, una vez que Žste ha sido autenticado por medio de una arquitectura SSO.

RESUMEN: Symptoms of many diseases, such as diabetes and hypertension, are characterised by changes in structure of the retinal vascular tree. In this work, we present three approaches to blood vessel segmentation, the first two approaches are aimed at low resolution images and they are evaluated using DRIVE dataset, the third approach is aimed at higher resolution images and is evaluated using HRF dataset, the last two approaches are proposed by us. On the other hand, extraction of image features and use of an automatic learning technique, such as neural networks, for blood vessels classification into arteries and veins. In addition, skeletonisation and extraction of vessel geometrical features are used for detection and classification of bifurcations and crossings. Experimental evaluation for the third segmentation approach, using HRF dataset, indicates that it correctly identifies 96.2% of pixels. Moreover, the proposed blood vessel classification approach correctly identifies 84.1% of pixels belonging to arteries and veins. Finally, geometrical-features based model detects and classifies correctly 94.1% of bifurcations and crossings.
